events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim for damages sustained in the accident.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the customer's car in a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage and follow up on the customer's auto accident claim promptly.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and the start of processing their auto accident case.
The insurance company requested accident reports, photographs of vehicle damages, and the police report from the customer.
The customer submitted all requested documents including police reports and multiple pictures of the damaged vehicle parts.
A formal investigation into the circumstances of the accident began, involving review of submitted evidence and witness statements.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and total estimates of repair costs for the customer's damaged vehicle.
The insurer proposed a settlement offer based on the investigation findings and damage evaluations for the vehicle repairs.
The customer responded with dissatisfaction regarding the offered settlement amount, requesting a review and reassessment.
Due to customer dissatisfaction, the claim was escalated to a senior claims adjuster for further review and negotiation.
After reevaluation, the claim was approved with an increased settlement amount to better cover the vehicle repair expenses.
The agreed settlement payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to facilitate timely vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after the settlement was paid and the customer confirmed satisfaction with the resolution.
All claim records and associated documentation were securely archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
